DOC.brief_summary: Recent studies revealed that the ex vivo enzyme-linked immunospot (ELISPOT) assay for gamma interferon is a specific method for contact tracing of Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection. However, its use in endemic area and bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG)-vaccinated hosts has not been proved. We hypothesize that the TB-ELISPOT assay can be a rapid and accurate diagnostic tool for active tuberculosis in clinical suspects in Taiwan.
DOC.brief_title: Diagnosis of Active Tuberculosis by ELISPOT
DOC.criteria: Patients who present with fever or respiratory symptoms (cough, dyspnea, or hemoptysis) lasting for ≥ 2 weeks and have compatible radiographic findings were considered clinical suspects of TB.
DOC.keyword: Tuberculosis, TB-ELISPOT, active tuberculosis latent infection interferon
